review_title: Enables you to make a positive impact
pros: An organisation that is leading a movement to unite engineers present and future in serving people and the planet. Excellent working environment, and a team structure which promotes collaboration and support. It feels good to work for an organisation which is making a noticeable positive change in the world. The working environment is lovely; the office building has several roof terraces, Pilates classes, ping pong, and building events like BBQs.
cons: There is/will be construction opposite the office building for the next few years, so this could be an issue if you are sensitive to background noise.

pros:
This is overall a wonderful and positive place to work 
You’ll be part of a team that really care your personal and professional development - I was mentored and always given opportunities to learn and grow

Your opinion and input is always valued - the structure is very horizontal

cons: There are not many opportunities to be promoted as it is a small charity for now

job_title: Community Events Intern in London, England
pros:
I have thoroughly enjoyed working at Engineers Without Borders UK this summer. I worked closely with every member of the team and have  had many opportunities to develop confidence in skills such as: Communication, Logistics Planning and Resource Development.
The Engineers Without Borders UK Team work very well together and regularly organise team building days, lunches and more to create a very inclusive and supportive environment.
I look forward to working with them in the future.
cons: I really can't fault anything during my time working here, I would say commuting is difficult, especially during matches and events at The Oval which is very nearby.
